name: a8a64e59-6d0e-44a9-8f40-52f86ee14485
displayName: Happy Path - User wants to know about Out of pocket maximums(FAQ)

text: Hi, I'm your virtual healthcare agent. I can help answer your healthcare claims questions, understand your benefits, and find a doctor. How can I assist you today?

text.text: What’s a Out of pocket maximums

text:
An out of pocket max is the maximum amount you will pay for covered services in a given year. After you reach the maximum you will no longer have co-insurance or a co-pay when you get care.
Please note that your plan has a different out of pocket max for in network and out of network care.

For example: If your in network out of pocket maximum is $2500, you won't pay anything when you see an in-network provider 

I can further help you and answer your questions about your benefits plan, healthcare claims and assist you to find a doctor.

text.text: No, thank you for the help

text: Okay, glad I could help. A transcript of our conversation will be stored in the messages section of your patient portal. Press 5 if you’re willing to fill out a survey on your experience today. Have a great day!
